user_query: Show me some DATA SCIENCE course from UDacity

debug_info.user_query: Show me some DATA SCIENCE course from UDacity

original_data.Title: Introduction to Data Analysis
original_data.Short Intro: Start your data science journey right with this hands-on introduction to the discipline of data analysis. In this course you'll learn the 5 key stages of the data analysis process and apply them to real data sets using Python libraries NumPy, pandas, and Matplotlib.
original_data.What you learn: Data analysis is a rigorous discipline that can reveal illuminating insights, but a strong grasp of the fundamentals is essential to generating accurate, useful results. This hands-on course will teach you the industry-standard framework for analyzing data of any kind, and show you how to apply it using some of the most popular tools in data science.

unified_data.title: Introduction to Data Analysis

This hands-on course will teach you the industry-standard framework for analyzing data of any kind, and show you how to apply it using some of the most popular tools in data science

original_data.Title: Learn to Code
original_data.Short Intro: Udacity's Intro to Programming is your first step towards careers in Web and App Development, Machine Learning, Data Science, AI, and more! This program is perfect for beginners.
original_data.Prequisites: In order to succeed, we recommend having experience using the web, being able to perform a search on Google, and (most importantly) the determination to keep pushing forward!
original_data.What you learn: Learn the basics of programming through HTML, CSS, Python, and JavaScript. Get extensive practice with hands-on exercises and projects that demonstrate your grasp of coding fundamentals, and build confidence in your ability to think and problem-solve like a programmer.

original_data.Title: Programming for Data Science with R
original_data.Short Intro: Prepare for a data science career by learning the fundamental data programming tools: R, SQL, command line, and git.
original_data.Courses: Learn to Code with R and SQL
original_data.Prequisites: There are no prerequisites for this program, aside from basic computer skills.
original_data.What you learn: Learn the programming fundamentals required for a career in data science. By the end of the program, you will be able to use R, SQL, Command Line, and Git.

unified_data.title: Programming for Data Science with R
unified_data.description: Prepare for a data science career by learning the fundamental data programming tools: R, SQL, command line, and git.
prerequisites: There are no prerequisites for this program, aside from basic computer skills
learning_outcomes: Learn the programming fundamentals required for a career in data science
By the end of the program, you will be able to use R, SQL, Command Line, and Git

original_data.Title: Data Science for Business Leaders
original_data.Short Intro: Master the strategic decision-making skills for the people, platforms, and processes required to leverage the power of Data Science in your business.
original_data.Prequisites: To optimize your chances of success in this Executive Program, we recommend prior exposure to statistics and probability, as well as experience in business decision-making in an IT or technical environment.
original_data.What you learn: This course provides business leaders and managers with strategies and guidelines for how best to solve the human capital, technological, and management challenges of building data science into the business. Students will gain skills in identifying opportunities for data science across many functional areas of the business, as well as learn the tools to prioritize and execute on those opportunities as part of a data science initiative.

original_data.Title: Programming for Data Science with Python
original_data.Short Intro: Prepare for a data science career by learning the fundamental data programming tools: Python, SQL, command line, and git.
original_data.Courses: Learn to Code in Python and SQL
original_data.Prequisites: There are no prerequisites for this program, aside from basic computer skills.
original_data.What you learn: Learn the programming fundamentals required for a career in data science. By the end of the program, you will be able to use Python, SQL, Command Line, and Git.

original_data.Title: How to Become a Data Scientist
original_data.Short Intro: Gain real-world data science experience with projects designed by industry experts. Build your portfolio and advance your data science career.
original_data.Prequisites: We recommend students are familiar with machine learning concepts, like those in the Intro to Machine Learning Nanodegree Program. In addition, students should be familiar with Python programming, probability, and statistics.
original_data.What you learn:
You’ll master the skills necessary to become a successful Data Scientist. You’ll work on projects designed by industry experts, and learn to run data pipelines, design experiments, build recommendation systems, and deploy solutions to the cloud.

 If you already have experience with machine learning, take this program.

unified_data.title: How to Become a Data Scientist
unified_data.description: Gain real-world data science experience with projects designed by industry experts. Build your portfolio and advance your data science career.
prerequisites: We recommend students are familiar with machine learning concepts, like those in the Intro to Machine Learning Nanodegree Program
In addition, students should be familiar with Python programming, probability, and statistics
learning_outcomes: You’ll master the skills necessary to become a successful Data Scientist
You’ll work on projects designed by industry experts, and learn to run data pipelines, design experiments, build recommendation systems, and deploy solutions to the cloud
If you already have experience with machine learning, take this program

original_data.Title: Learn Intermediate Python
original_data.Short Intro: Gain practitioner-level skills with Python and learn the language powering transformation in Data Science, Machine Learning, and beyond.
original_data.Prequisites: Basic familiarity with programming in Python.
original_data.What you learn: Python is a general-purpose coding language with applications in web development, data science, machine learning, fintech and more. The Intermediate Python Nanodegree program equips you to leverage the capabilities of Python and streamline the functionality of applications that perform complex tasks, such as classifying files, data mining a webpage, etc. By the end of the program, you’ll have a portfolio that demonstrates your ability to apply practicioner-level Python skills on the job.

unified_data.title: Learn Intermediate Python
unified_data.description: Gain practitioner-level skills with Python and learn the language powering transformation in Data Science, Machine Learning, and beyond.
prerequisites: Basic familiarity with programming in Python
learning_outcomes: Python is a general-purpose coding language with applications in web development, data science, machine learning, fintech and more

The Intermediate Python Nanodegree program equips you to leverage the capabilities of Python and streamline the functionality of applications that perform complex tasks, such as classifying files, data mining a webpage, etc
By the end of the program, you’ll have a portfolio that demonstrates your ability to apply practicioner-level Python skills on the job

original_data.Title: Experimental Design & Recommendations
original_data.Short Intro: Learn two of the most in-demand skills in the entire field of data science! By the end of this course, you’ll know how to generate personalized recommendations based on user data, as well as run statistically valid tests that produce clean, interpretable results.
original_data.What you learn: The world’s leading tech companies — including Amazon, Netflix, and Spotify — all use recommendation engines to engage their users and experiments to improve their products. In this course, you’ll get a comprehensive breakdown of the techniques and considerations that go into building these systems (including pitfalls that invalidate your results if you’re not careful!). You’ll also complete two hands-on projects using real data from Starbucks and IBM’s Watson Studio platform.
